From HYPERION'S purple Wain,</br>Pendent o'er the western main,</br>Twinkling thro' the twilight shade,</br>Arrowey lines of splendor play'd;</br>Silence, on her pinion clos'd,</br>Deaf to sorrow's wail, repos'd,</br>Save, that where fresher buds betray</br>The silver streamlet's sinewy way,</br>A Naiad, all to song unknown,</br>With moist heel slipp'd from stone to stone,</br>And stole adown the haunted dale,</br>To chide the tardy Nightingale;</br>When, his beechen bow'r beneath,</br>Hung with many a field-flow'r wreath,</br>Pensive PAINTING, first, essay'd</br>The semblance of a fav'rite maid:</br>FANCY! — whom he, oft, had seen,</br>Nymph-like, tripping o'er the green,</br>Richly dight in varied hues,</br>(By her side the tendant Muse,)</br>What time, with heav'n's own dyes imprest,</br>The glitt'ring Rainbow zon'd her breast.</br>Artless, first, the sketch began;</br>Rude the pencil's early plan;</br>'Till from the waving wood behind,</br>Whose foliage shook without a wind,</br>Proud to fan his genuine flame,</br>The pitying Pow'rs of PAINTING came.

First, in decent garb array'd,</br>Succint with pearly clasp her stole,</br>Slow advanc'd a meek-ey'd Maid,</br>And curb'd the workings of his soul;</br>With easy grace her state she mov'd;</br>Each fault her patient touch improv'd;</br>The long, luxuriant line,</br>She gave with chaster charm to flow;</br>And, from her blue cloud's ruby-tinctur'd glow,</br>Pleas'd BEAUTY, stooping, smil'd upon DESIGN.

Next appear'd a twin-like Pair;</br>One, flush'd with bloom, divinely fair,</br>Dusky one, of negro-race,</br>Yet amiable either face;</br>Quick they thrid the checquer'd maze,</br>Borrowing still, and lending aid,</br>While the mellowing tint betrays,</br>The sweet diversity of LIGHT and SHADE.

But who is she, exactly drest,</br>With classic care, in ATTIC vest!</br>Her slender leg with buskin bound:</br>And now, still changing as she turns,</br>Bright on her starry front the turban burns,</br>Anon, with ROMAN casque, or INDIAN plumage crown'd;</br>Behind her follow, SCIENCE, daring youth!</br>And taleful MEM'RY, and HISTORIC TRUTH.

But oh!  how rich the bosom-shrine,</br>Op'ning to thy pure possession,</br>Thou!  whose eyes so softly shine,</br>How they languish! — fond EXPRESSION!</br>On the finish'd piece they pour</br>Saintly-fading gleams of glory;</br>O'er each scene, and o'er each story,</br>Breathing an irradiate show'r:</br>Whether, (fair COLOURING ardent by thy side,)</br>On opal tow'r thou fling'st thy moonlight-beam;</br>Or tinge the murd'rer's poignard, slaughter-dy'd,</br>And shed strange horrors on the sanguine stream;</br>Or, inly bleeding, while he bends to trace</br>The sacred scroll of long-remember'd woe;</br>Thy spell anneals the tears, that, ling'ring, flow,</br>Down the pale ruins of the Lover's face!</br>
